title: Paramount+ Adds 6.8 Million Subscribers in First Quarter
sub_head: Streaming service got boost from ‘Star Trek: Picard,’ ‘Halo,’ NFL games
body:
Paramount Global said its main streaming platform, Paramount+, added 6.8 million subscribers during the first quarter, as the service benefited from original content including “Halo” and a “Star Trek” series, as well as National Football League games.
The company, home of CBS, Nickelodeon and the Paramount movie studio, said Paramount+ had nearly 40 million subscribers as of March 31, an increase of more than 20% from the 32.8 million total customers it had as of Dec. 31. Last quarter, the company renamed itself from ViacomCBS to Paramount, a sign of its focus on streaming and a nod to its history as a filmmaker.
